name: Three Corners Fayrouz Plaza Beach Resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for a week in the heat of August. Hotel is new, and as such is to a very good standard throughout. Rooms were spacious and had good AC (which was needed!). The clientelle is very European, with a large amount of Italians (prob about 20% Brits)
reviews.title: Never a 5 star hotel, but still a good 3-4 star hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.text: - Just a 5-10 airport transfer (you can't hear or see the planes coming in)
reviews.title: Stunning location
Rude staff & poor service
reviews.text: - Long jetty taking you out to the house reef which could keep you occupied for hours (espeically at high tide so you can get over the reef to the drop-off)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: - The A La Carte restaurant was definately worth a visit. Cost about £16 each for a three course meal (AI drinks included). Made a really nice change from the buffet restaurant (which we were getting a bit tired of)
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel!

likes.disliked: — Unable to walk staight into sea due to corals

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have just returned from 2 weeks at the Fayrouz Plaza and we had a great time. We are a couple 28 and 26 and this is the perfect place to relax. There is not much going on and is a place to chill which is exactely what we wanted with great snorkelling and reefs.
reviews.title: Fantastic place, great people, fab time

likes.liked: — 5 star hotel, great pool, beach and facilities
likes.disliked: — No where to go except the hotel bars

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location - close to airport. near port gallib - not finished but when it is you wont get 2 weeks for UK500.00 or less.
reviews.title: Misleading Thomson Holiday Brochure(s)

reviews.text: Accommodation - Very high class, extremely clean. Very impressive modern lobby and rooms were very nice. King size bed, quilts and lots of pillows. Restaurant clean and fantastic views. Panoramic terrace- amazing very relaxing fantastic views.
reviews.title: Great Time !!

reviews.text: My Husband, daughter ( 7) and myself holidayed at the 3 corners Fayrouz 29th Oct – 5th Nov. We flew from Manchester to Marsa alam with Monarch – I have to say it wasn’t the best flight quite cramped and not very comfortable, it was an early morning flight and we did ( stupidly ) expect breakfast pretty quickly but instead it was a money making exercise of drinks and snacks first.
reviews.title: we saw turtles !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We landed on time and the airport and transfer were quick and painless, check in was good and we were taken to our room 2021 far left of complex and with a sea view. Room was clean and tidy but basic - shower had plenty of hot water.
reviews.title: Excellent location and relaxing resort

likes.disliked: — The grounds were still very barren in places

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: During our time there it was very windy I think it must be like this pretty much year round as wind breaks are a permanent fixture, we did find the wind a bit annoying as got sand blasted frequently and also it made the sea and snorkelling a bit bouncy (if anyone knows when its not windy please let me know!) However we all got a great tan temps high 20’s even low 30’s and low 20’s in evening. Days are short light at 6am dark at 5pm. Beach is clean plenty of sun beds and parasols; you will get folk coming along to sell quad bikes, massage etc also camel rides on beach.
reviews.title: Great hotel, shame about the food

likes.liked: — Great looking hotel and low rise accommodation

reviews.text: When it was a little calmer snorkelling off the end of the pier was good with a variety of fish, we also walked to the bay to the right (if you look out to sea) where we snorkelled and saw turtles which was fab !!
reviews.title: the food really lets this hotel down
Great Hotel / Food ok.
reviews.text: Entertainment was ok , my daughter enjoyed the kids club – thanks Natalia ! And also the nightly mini disco, English people were in the minority but this didn’t bother us.

description: Located next to the new marina of Ghalib-Marsa Alam on the west coast of the Red Sea, Egypt, Hotel The Three Corners Fayrouz Plaza Beach Resort is an exclusive property located only 5 km / 3 miles from Marsa Alam Airport and 67 km / 42 miles from Quseir. This outstanding area is a renowned Red Sea holiday destination for its long beaches and coral reefs, and therefore this all-inclusive hotel is the ideal place for sea lovers and divers. Families will also spend a memorable stay thanks to a well-organized kids club with a wide range of activities and games for your children. Furthermore, the entertainment team offers a full week schedule with different sports and a lot of fun! Guest amenities at The Three Corners Fayrouz Plaza Beach Resort also include a gorgeous private beach and a huge swimming pool with Jacuzzi and a children pool, 2 restaurants, 4 bars (lobby bar, swimming pool bar, beach bar, Peanuts bar) and many shops (pharmacy, gift shop, jewelry, Oriental herb shop and fashion shops). Sport facilities include table tennis, billiards, aerobics, darts, beach volleyball, water polo, water games, snorkeling, Entertainment room (electronic darts, billiards, table tennis), beach soccer, bocci, diving, spa and gym. Wireless Internet access is also available.
